CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 3, 1943, pg. 4 reads: Here Is Democracy...Detroit Style!...A Story In Pictures - The Pittsburgh Courier's Charles Harris, staff photographer, was rushed to Detroit last week, after Langford James, Detroit staff photographer, had his arm seriously injured when police manhandled him as he was taking pictures. Here is the graphic picture story Mr. Harris "snapped" of the "raiding" and machine-gunning of the swank Vernor Apartment hotel, on the corner of Vernor and Brush.  The first picture shows the hotel, which houses 88 families in two to four-room apartments.  Upper insert is a close-up of the windows, showing where bullets entered the building and ricocheted off the walls..."
TitMainTitle: Vernor Apartment hotel, corner of East Vernor Highway and Brush Street, Detroit, Michigan, another version
